node.title: Poem: Buried Abecedary for Intensive Care
node.description: A poem does its thing when you leave it regretting, just a little bit, learning something youâ€™d swear you already knew.
node.content: ["\u201cIt\u2019s called hipaa when no one tells.\u201d But I\u2019ll tell you this, Laura Kolbe\u2019s prose poem \u201cBuried Abecedary for Intensive Care\u201d is a poem of these times. It\u2019s not about Covid, but my God \u2014 from line to line I am remembering all that we\u2019ve learned to lose these past two years. You must be a legend of two sports like PeeWee Kirkland to write this, and I\u2019m reminded that a poem does its thing when you leave it regretting, just a little bit, learning something you\u2019d swear you already knew.", "By Laura Kolbe", "", ""]
